body.p: Light SIMD is a C++ template library that provides flexible and portable API for writing SIMD codes. In addition, it has the following features.

ul.li: Generic interfaces for writing platform-independent codes.

Support of a rich set of functions, which include
arithmetic calculation
a full coverage of transcendental math functions
comparison and logical operations
reduction functions (e.g. sum, max, and min)
entry manipulation (e.g. swizzling, shuffling, shifting, and entry extraction)
See the function list for details.

Linear algebra module, which contains SIMD-based classes to represent small vectors and matrices, and a variety of linear algebraic computation:
template classes to represent small fixed-size vectors and matrices
matrix-vector and matrix-matrix products
evaluation of trace and determinant
matrix inversion and linear equation solving
codes specially optimized for vectors of lengths 2, 3, and 4 and matrices of sizes: 2 x 2, 2 x 3, 2 x 4, 3 x 2, 3 x 3, 3 x 4, 4 x 2, 4 x 3, and 4 x 4
Light weight classes and always-inlined functions, which incur zero run-time overhead (in release mode).
Extensively tested using hundreds of unit testing cases.
